item.title: About the OCM Project
item.description: The Open Component Model project provides an open standard for describing software artifacts and lifecycle metadata, with the purpose to securely deliver and deploy software products.

item.title: Overview
item.description: What is the Open Component Model? OCM is an open standard for describing software artifacts and lifecycle metadata. It is a technology-agnostic and machine-readable format and focuses on software artifacts that need to be delivered securely across boundaries.

item.title: Context
item.description: The definition, structure and lifecycle-management of software in larger enterprises often builds upon tools and processes, which originate from former on-premise thinking and monolithic architectures.

item.title: Scope
item.description: Aspects of operating software products Operating software products, both for cloud and on-premises, covers many aspects: How, when and where are the technical artifacts created?

item.title: Specification
item.description: Where to find the OCM specification The most up-to-date version of the OCM specification offers you a deep insight to all technical details of the Open Component Model and explains all elements the model OCM is based on.

item.title: Installing the OCM CLI
item.description: Using Binaries To install the OCM CLI you can download binaries for the major platforms from the GitHub releases page.

item.title: First Steps with OCM
item.description: This chapter walks you through some basic steps to get started with OCM concepts and the OCM CLI. You will learn how to create a component version, display and examine the component and how to transport and sign it.

item.title: Architecture
item.description: This document explains the architecture of the OCM Kubernetes Controller Set (KCS). The purpose of the KCS is to enable the automated deployment of components using Kubernetes and Flux.

item.title: Installation
item.description: ocm-controller The ocm-controller can be installed using the OCM CLI: ocm controller install This command will install the ocm-controller in the kubernetes cluster specified by the current KUBECONFIG context.
